split.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if a group of people splits, or if it is split, people in the group disagree strongly with each other and the group sometimes divides into separate smaller groups
split.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: It was feared that the issue would split the church.
The war has split the nation in two.
split something in two/down the middle
The party is split over the issue of immigration.
The government appears deeply split on this issue.
The Pan-Africanist Congress split from the ANC in 1959.
split.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
split.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Can you split into groups of three now?
The book is split into six sections.
split.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if something splits, or if you split it, it tears or breaks along a straight line
split.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The branch split under their weight.
One of the boxes had split open.
The board had split in two.
Split the pineapple down the middle.
split.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to divide something into separate parts and share it between two or more people
split.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: We agreed to split the cost.
The money will have to be split three ways.
Profits will be split between three major charities.
He agreed to sell the car and split the proceeds with his brother.
split.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to make someone’s head or lip have a cut in it, as a result of a fall or hit
split.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: She fell against a table and split her lip.
The force of the blow nearly split his head open.
split.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: if people split, they end a marriage or relationship with each other
split.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The band split two years ago.
He split from his wife last year.
split.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a tear or crack in something made of cloth, wood etc
split.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a long split in the sleeve of his coat
split.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a serious disagreement that divides an organization or group of people into smaller groups
split.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The argument could lead to a damaging split in the party.
a deep split within the government
a split between the radicals and the moderates within the group
The union is desperate to avoid a split over this issue.
split.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the end of a marriage or relationship – used especially in newspapers and magazines
split.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: She seems to be getting over her recent split with her fiancé.
split.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: the way in which something, especially money, is shared between several people
split.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: In a publishing deal, the average split used to be 50:50 between writer and publisher.
a three-way split in the profits
split.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: a clear separation or difference between two things
split.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: the traditional split between the state and church
split.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to divide something into separate parts so that two or more people each get a part
split.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: We agreed to split the fee.
The merger forced us to split operations between London and Edinburgh.
All profits will be split three ways  (=into three parts).
split.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to divide or separate something into different parts, or be divided into different parts
split.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: They planned to split into three companies to fight the bid.
He plans to split the firm up between his two sons.
split.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: to divide a company’s shares into smaller units so that the value of each share is reduced and the number of shares is increased. This may be done to make it easier to buy and sell the shares
split.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: The company is splitting its 5p nominal shares into units of 2.5p to make them more marketable.
split.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: to agree on a price, charge etc that is exactly half-way between the one that has been offered and the one that has been asked for
split.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: the act of sharing money between a group of people, organizations etc, or the share that each group gets
split.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: I paid by credit card for two equal split payments.
The partners have agreed a three-way split (=a share of something that is divided equally between three people).
